St. Joseph's College of Engineering Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: The right path to our future.

detailed_review.Placements: Students at this college are placed on campus more frequently. The average package is 9 LPA, the lowest is 5 LPA, and the highest being 15 LPA. 85 percent of students are able to secure on-campus internships with organizations such as Microsoft, Wipro, and Flipkart.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has a sizable library with almost all the books we want. Canteens that offer delectable snacks at affordable prices, and smart boards that let students learn subjects through visual aids. Snacks cultivated and made on campus are more affordable. Students can get whatever they need at this college because it has the best facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The vast training of professors is demonstrated by the fact that most of them hold Ph.D.s in a variety of areas. They work hard to ensure that everyone understands the concepts and provide a great deal of assistance with the placement process. To help students prepare for the workforce, the college provides industry tours and internships. If you pay attention in class, exams are easy, and you can earn good scores.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: I'm absolutely satisfied because of the seniors.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college, up to 80% of the seniors got placed in many companies. The lowest package is 3.5 LPA, and the highest package is around 47 LPA. More than 1,080 companies visit per semester. In our batch, there are many students, with 60%. The roles offered are software engineer, developer, and tester.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities of our college are good, and the infrastructure looks very traditional, as well as innovative. They split the students into two types, one is HOPE, and the second is PEP. There is a library with many articles, and compared to other colleges, our college food is so good.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our college, the teachers are friendly with the students, and we can clarify our doubts. They never hesitate to help us in any situation. They make us strong in technical skills through hands-on practice. The semester exams are very easy, as they give a particular topic to learn, and if we study, that's enough to pass.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my relative, who is currently studying in the 4th year of the same course. She got an internship. It's good, and there are many events that are going to happen, most of them happening in the 6th semester.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: The college has good infrastructure, faculty members, and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: The college offers excellent placement opportunities. Over 80% of students were successfully placed in reputed companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college provides quality food, clean and well-maintained hostels. Spacious grounds that encourage students to engage in various sports and physical activities.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Having a good experience at this college. It has good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a student of CSE from the (2025 passing out) batch of St. Joseph's College of Engineering, Chennai. Approximately 75-80 perecnt of students from my course got placed during the recent placement season. The highest package offered is 47 LPA, the lowest is around 3 LPA, and the average package is 6 LPA. Top recruiters for our course included Infosys, TCS, Cognizant, Wipro, Accenture, Zoho, HCL and Tiger Analytics. Around 25 percent of students from my course received internships in companies such as Ashok Leyland and other core/IT firms.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department is equipped with spacious classrooms, fully air-conditioned computer and research labs and high-speed Wi-Fi throughout the academic blocks. Campus also includes a well-stocked central library with digital access to journals and e-books relevant to our course. Smart boards and projectors are available in most classrooms to support interactive learning. The hostels offer good infrastructure with clean rooms, 24X7 water and electricity, and Wi-Fi access. The quality of food in the mess is decent and hygienic, with both vegetarian and non-vegetarian options available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our department are helpful, highly qualified, and knowledgeable in their respective subjects. Most faculty members hold postgraduate or doctoral degrees and are approachable for academic support. The teaching quality is effective, with a mixture of theoretical instruction and practical application. The course curriculum is well-structured and is regularly updated to align with current industry trends. It includes both core subjects and electives relevant to the job market, along with project work and practical training that help students become industry-ready.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: The college that makes my dream come true.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70%-75% of students got placed and top recruiting is Edu-Varsity and Federal Bank. The highest package is Rs 14 LPA and the lowest is Rs 4 LPA. Many students got internship opportunities around Tamil Nadu.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The department offers Wi-Fi connections, a modern lab with A/C facilities, a smart class is also there and they have a well-stocked library. Hostels are clean with basic amenities and the food provided in the mess is tasty. Also, they have canteen and the prices are very less compared to other canteens and good medical facilities. They also have an indoor and outdoor court to ensure the balance of the student.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful to the students. They are well-qualified and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is very good and the curriculum is everything mostly related to industry. Semester exams are moderate in difficulty and the passing percentage is 80% to 90%.
detailed_review.Other: The reason I chose this college is because they make ordinary students into self-disciplined students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: College has nice infrastructure and great faculty, but students still couldn't get enough exposure.

detailed_review.Placements: About 70% of my seniors are placed in our department. The lowest package offered is around 3-4 LPA, the highest package is 47 LPA, and the average package offered is around 6-8 LPA. Some of the top recruiting companies so far are Amazon, Google, Microsoft, Zoho, etc. In my current batch, about 20% of students got internships as of now. Some of the internship companies are C1X, PWC, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is good, with many facilities, and it is also easy to fit in quickly. The hostel infrastructure is not that great, because the rooms are not worth the fees we pay every year. It is a decent place to stay.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good and helpful when it comes to academics. They really try to help the students, and they also keep pushing students to learn new things. 99% of faculty members are well-qualified, knowledgeable, and easily approachable whenever needed. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students ready for the industry. Semester exams are not that hard as we get to write three model examinations before the final semester examination. The current pass percentage for each subject is 45% out of 100%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose Artificial Intelligence and Data Science because it is an emerging and evolving field across the globe in recent times. I was able to see how this domain of Artificial Intelligence has brought an impact on society. There are a very few events conducted in our college called Cultural Day. It is conducted for each batch separately on a different date, where we wear our traditional wear and participate in various competitions. The other event is College Day, similarly conducted for each academic batch separately, where students participate in dancing and win prizes.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: My college is a bright future for the youth.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of students got placed. The lowest package is 2.4 LPA and the highest is 47 LPA. Recruiting companies are Amazon, Accenture, TCS, Ennvee, Zoho, Turing, JMan, Hexaware, LTI, Mindtree, Vealvo, Myways AI, MU Sigma, and Avasoft. 20% of students got internships at Amazon, TCS, Zoho, Myways AI, Turning, Avasoft. Top role offered is SDE.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are available like Wi-Fi, 3 Labs, classrooms, library, smart classrooms, dispensary room, etc. Hostel is available with 24/7 Wi-Fi, good quality beds and pillows, twice daily room cleaning, laundry facilities, unlimited good-quality food, and a very large playing area.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers provide good knowledge to students. Most teachers completed Ph.D. course. The course helps students to get ready for the industry requirements. Semester exams are easy because they provide the study material to get a good score. Pass percentage is above 90%.
detailed_review.Other: Events are fine in my college. I chose this course because I am interested in IT fields. They provide various help to students like scholarships, free education for 1st graduates, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: It is a good college with very high fees.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college provides very good placements this year more than the previous year. This year our college five seniors got placements in Amazon and Service Now companies with a salary package of 44 LPA. This year it was the record for placements in our college. So the placements are good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is okay. But the hostel infrastructure is very poor. A Wi-Fi facility is available in the hostel and college. The hostel's Wi-Fi is poor. In 1st year hostel, there is no space for air to come in. In the second-year hostel, the air is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are perfect. Semester exams are easier than models. In model exams, they give us important questions and it is enough to get pass marks in model exams. Three model exams are conducted. If we study then we will get passing marks in semester exams.
detailed_review.Other: The college is very big so we get tired of walking in the hostel and classrooms.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good environment, but placements are good in the earlier stage. College is strict.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 40% of students are placed in my course. The highest salary package offered is 9 LPA and the lowest salary package offered is 2 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Accenture, Infosys, Soliton, HCL, and Mindtree. About 20% of students got their internships. Top role offered in my course is production engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of the department is good but the Wi-Fi facilities are weak. Labs and classrooms are good. In the classroom, there is no Wi-Fi. The network is also low. Library is good. The food is excellent. In our college, it's compulsory to pay fee for food. Canteen is not good. Medical facilities are available in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are well-qualified They teach us clearly but some others will show their attitude towards Students. This course curriculum is relevant. Semester exams are easy to pass. The staff will give some important questions during the exams. The pass percentage is 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I got this course through counseling I have no other options. The best part of this course is there is no coding. Hands-on practice can be implemented. Scholarships will be given to the students. All extracurricular activities are conducted.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Choose the best needed to become the best.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students that will be placed is around 80%, and the remaining will choose off-campus interviews. Zoho and HCL are the top recruiting companies that come to our college. Almost 50% of the students will be offered an internship before the last year. Full stack developer and web developer are the top roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There will be canteen facilities, drinking water facilities, a gym, and a large library that consists of plenty of books for the hostel students, and even day scholars can opt for that. The quality of food is good, and there is special treatment for students opting for sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful and qualified, and they are well-educated. The teaching in our college is better compared to other colleges, and the semester exams will be a little tough as they contain 15% of content outside of the books that are referred to in our college.
detailed_review.Other: Computer Science is one of the fast-growing courses in the information technology field as it serves as the core for many. AI is one of the best for this course.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good food, strict rules, good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Totally, 75 percent of students get placed every year. On average, the package will range between 3 LPA - 10 LPA, but this year 5 of our college students got placed with an offer of 44 LPA. So, if you have skills, you have more chances of getting placed in a good company.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is somewhat average since it is a 30-year-old college, but new buildings being constructed have some good infrastructure. Wi-Fi is available only in the hostel and lab; no Wi-Fi is available in classrooms. Labs are good with all the necessary equipment, and hostel food quality is also above average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Even though teaching quality of some teachers is lagging, all the teachers have exceptional knowledge about their handling subjects. They update themselves regularly by studying new courses and getting certifications in it. Passing in semester exams is easy as the passing percentage is 50.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: The correct route to your future.

detailed_review.Placements: With an average package of 8.5 lacs, the lowest being 9 lacs, and the highest being 17.5 lacs, students at this college were placed on campus more frequently. 87% of students were able to get internships on campus with companies like Flipkart, Microsoft, and Wipro.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college includes a large library with nearly all the books we need, canteens that serve delicious refreshments at a reasonable cost, and smart boards that allow students to learn topics visually. Snacks produced and grown on campus are offered at less money. With the best facilities, students may obtain all they need at this college.
detailed_review.Faculty: The majority of the faculty members have Ph.D.s in various specialties, demonstrating their extensive training. They put a lot of effort into making sure everyone grasps the ideas and offer a lot of help with the placing procedure. The college offers internships and industry trips to help students get ready for the workforce. Exams are simple if you pay attention in class, which is enough to get decent grades.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Best engineering college in Chennai.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements here are really good. Many companies come to campus, and students often get offers as early as their third year. The highest package offered for the year 2024 was 27 LPA which was offered by Juspay. Companies that recruit students from this college include TCS, Infosys, CTS, Accenture, Wipro, Teach Mahindra and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college provides Wi-Fi in all the labs, and each floor has a lab, so the Wi-Fi can reach the classrooms. Still mobile phones are not allowed. There is no canteen inside the college, but there is a stall that sells fries and noodles and a bakery that sells baked goods at very low prices.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some of the faculty are new and are up to date on the latest technology while others are older but have a wealth of knowledge and experience. All of the faculty are helpful and willing to guide students in their studies and projects. Students who are self-motivated will do well here. The staff provides students with ample time to work on their projects in the labs which makes for a better learning experience.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Best college for the people who follow rules and study well.

detailed_review.Placements: The packages were much less than I expected. They seem to have fallen down on the job. Many companies like AWS, TCS, Google, IBM, Infosys, and many startup companies come for placements but they take only a few students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college hostel is clean and neat, and the food is good compared to other colleges. The college has the best lab facilities. Still the mobile data signal is weak in the hostel and on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers at this college are good. They are very helpful and provide career guidance to the students. They also encourage students to participate in events such as hackathons, presentations, dataothons and startup ideas. The course in artificial intelligence and machine learning is a difficult one. Students who are good at math and have problem-solving skills will do well in this course.
detailed_review.Other: I really like this college. It has a lot to offer. There are fests on campus, and they provide a lot of scholarships. They also conduct a lot of activities which I enjoy. The crowd is above average which is a plus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: In our college, food, teaching, and infrastructure are too good.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college are good for computer-related courses. In chemical engineering, most students end up in IT rather than core jobs. Only five out of 60 students got core placements, but if you study well, you can secure a core position. Don't worry, you can at least get into IT. You can choose this college for a better future.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I'm currently in the 1st year. The hostel is good, and the overall infrastructure is very nice. However, many people say our college is one of the strictest in Chennai. They are strict about dress code, lab activities, and speaking in English. The food here is like heaven.
detailed_review.Faculty: They conduct about three model exams before the first semester and give internal marks based on these exams, along with small activities like PPT presentations and lab work. The teachers are experienced and skilled. The pass percentage of the college is high, but the college is a bit strict.
detailed_review.Other: In our college, the food is very nice, and it's considered the number one college in Chennai for having good hostel food. They also provide meals for day scholars.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: The right path to your future.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 80% of the students get jobs through campus interviews. This college provides extensive training to students to excel in the hiring process. The college hires top professionals to train students for the interview process, and they give their best to place the students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has smart boards to teach students through visual presentations of concepts, a huge library with almost all the books we need, and canteens offering tasty snacks at affordable prices. The college farms and makes its own snacks, which are sold at lower prices. This college has the best infrastructure where a student can get everything they need.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are highly trained, with most holding Ph.D. degrees in their respective fields. They work hard to ensure everyone understands the concepts and provide significant assistance in the placement process. The college prepares students to be industry-ready by offering internships and industrial visits. Exams are easy if you actively listen in class, which is sufficient to achieve good marks.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Memories of the College are the best.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement rate seems to be around 80%, with rumors circulating that Microsoft has banned the university from participating in their placement drives. The average package is about INR 36 lakhs, but there seems to be an issue with the faculty not adequately preparing students for placement interviews.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: They have separate hostels for athletes. There are multiple grounds, badminton courts, and everything else an athlete could ask for. There are many clubs where students can volunteer or participate in events and workshops they conduct. There are also signal jammers placed on campus to minimize mobile usage, which is quite annoying. The quality and taste of the food is very average, and there have also been reports of sometimes finding dead insects in the cooking utensils.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers don't seem to be very knowledgeable and mostly teach by going through presentations. The course curriculum is relevant, though, and includes computer languages that are used and taught in the modern day. The difficulty level of semester exams seems low, and exams are lengthy but not tough.

reviews.course: Integrated Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Absolutely, in this college, there are good facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: In this college, a students got more placement in this campus and the highest package is 18 Lacs, and the lowest package is 8 lakhs, and the average package is 8 Lacs. 47% of students got an internship in this campus, and companies are Microsoft, Wipro, and Flipkart.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In college, the infrastructure is good; in classrooms, there is a projector and TV. Wi-Fi connectivity is also there. In the library, there are more number of books. In the library and labs, materials are also there. I think the hostel is providing good facilities, good food, and medical facilities, and sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good, and there is a good relationship between teachers and students in this college. Good faculty members are there, and teachers understand the subjects for students. These subjects are difficult to pass in MBA course. The passing percentage is 56%.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of St. Joseph's College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: In mechanical engineering, the students placed in core are drastically low; they can also get placed in non-core software jobs in service-based companies. In our course, 4.21 LPA is the highest salary offered. Companies like Renault Nissan recruit us. 80 percent of students get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is not bad. Our department doesn't have a separate block now because of the low admission. But the laboratories are good. We have more labs than other departments. The library is overall okay. The quality of food in the hostel is good. The medical facility is bad.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are qualified enough to teach us. Some are really good. The teaching quality is okay, good. The course is mostly in theory, and I think it will make us industry-ready. The semester exams are easy. The pass percentage is good; most of us get passed.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Foodie College! Strict tooo.

detailed_review.Placements: This college is overall okay, but it will take at least one year to get the hang of it. 80 percent of students are placed in this college's last placement. We get an internship if you search alone, but they will give it on duty if it is a good company. The top roles offered are service-based.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is good if you are a foodie. But you can't go out of the hostel if you don't have a guardian nearby. They should come and pick you up. If you want to go out, Wi-Fi is available, but it will be lower than your internet, but Ethernet is fast enough.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty are good and friendly, helpful, and more likely experienced, but there are staff who are not experienced. Your fate even you can complain to the HOD to change the staff. They will see to that. Sem exams are easy if you study. A good pass percentage is given to the college.
detailed_review.Other: No campus crowds, no events, and everything in this college is food.

data.title: St Joseph's College of Engineering Placements 2025
summary: In the year 2025, St Joseph's College of Engineering witnessed commendable placement outcomes, reflecting strong industry engagement and student performance. A total of 1,224 offers were provided to students at St Joseph's College of Engineering. More than 18 offers were from Marquee . In all 312 companies participated during St Joseph's College of Engineering placement drive. Students were placed in over 25 sectors . The highest and the average package recorded was INR 47 LPA and INR 6 LPA .

When compared with 2024, 1,350 offers were given to students and a total of 920 students were placed. The placement rate recorded during the placement session was 78.29% . The average salary recorded in 2024 was INR 4.53 LPA presenting an increase of 32.45%.

college_info.college_name: TMU: Courses, Fees, Admissions 2025, Placements, Rankings

highlights.summary:
Teerthanker Mahaveer University (TMU Moradabad) is a recognised university and a member of UNAI (United Nations Academic Impact). It has also received the ICAR, NBA and NAAC accreditation at the grade of A. GNA University had been ranked 97 in the overall category in IIRF 2024 ranking and India Today 2024 had ranked 218 in the engineering category. TMU Moradabad has entered the MoUs with national universities and organisations of Great Lakes E-Learning Services, Whizhack Technologies, NVIDIA, BSNL, Sumandeep Vidhyapeeth University, and numerous others.
The GNA University is a privately owned university founded in 2008. The university boasts of over 10 schools and over 150 courses at UG, PG, and doctorate level. All these courses are UGC approved courses are being offered under several disciplines including Medical, Dental, Pharmacy, Nursing, Paramedical Sciences, Physiotherapy, Hospital Administration, Physical Education, Management, Engineering, Polytechnic, Law, Fine Arts, Agriculture and Jain Studies. BE/ BTech, BSc, MBBS, MA, and MBA are some of the popular courses in TMU Moradabad. BTech at Teerthanker Mahaveer University is achieved via JEE Mains examination and thereafter, counselling. The job market of MBA and MCA relies on the CAT, MAT, CMAT, XAT and university entrance test scores.
The highest package given through the TMU Moradabad placements was INR 60 LPA and the general placement rate was 82%. There is also a training and placement cell in Teerthanker Mahaveer University where various training and skills development programmes are run to students. The total strength of the university is over 15,000 students. The university provides students with a library, auditorium, seminar or conference halls, and guest houses, internet and Wi-Fi, hostels, canteen among others. reviews.course: B.A. LL.B. (Hons.)
reviews.review_title: My university has good infrastructure and has a Jain temple which is also very good.

detailed_review.Placements: I am pursuing B.A. LL.B. Hons. My batch is 2022 to 2027. There is no placement in the field of law at my university. 40 percent of students are placed in my course. Actually in my university there is no such package in Law. 5 to 10 percent of students got internships from my course such as NCLT, NALSA etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In my department there are Wi-Fi facilities but sometimes they are working and sometimes they are not working. There are labs but only juniors have access to them. Classroom desk and chair are good. Library has a vast number of books. Food, medical and sports facilities are provided in my hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and knowledgeable. Honesty speaking, the law department at my university is only good in discipline, but they do not provide us with practical knowledge. The semester exams are moderate in my college. Mainly 80 percent of students can pass the exam.
detailed_review.Other: I have a full interest in the law, which is why I chose this course, but I did not have idea that law at this university is this bad. My department should provide practical knowledge of the court work. Event, fest and Jain scholarship are good on campus, but I think there are so many restrictions for the girls like they cannot go to campus after 6:30 pm but boys have full freedom.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning)
reviews.review_title: Mixed experience: good infrastructure, poor faculty, decent placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Percent of students placed: Around 70-80% of students from B.Teach AI and ML at TMU get placed. The highest, the lowest, and the average package offered:The highest package offered was around 12 LPA, the lowest was about 3 LPA, and the average package was approximately 6 LPA. - Top Recruiting Companies: Top recruiters include companies like Infosys, TCS, Wipro, and some startups in AI/ML. - Percent of students who got internships: About 50-60% of students got internships in companies like Teach Startups, IT firms, and research organizations. Top Roles Offered: Top roles include AI/ML Engineer, Data Scientist, Software Developer, and AI Consultant.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: TMU has decent facilities, including labs with necessary software for AI/ML, Wi-Fi across campus, classrooms with projectors, and a library with relevant books. Quality of facilities in hostel, food, medical, and sports/games: Hostel facilities are average, mess food is okay with some variety, medical facilities are basic but available, and sports/games facilities like cricket, football, and badminton are decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty at TMU for B.Teach AI and ML are knowledgeable, providing decent support for complex topics. The curriculum covers core subjects like machine learning, data structures, and AI fundamentals, with a mix of theory and practical labs. Exams are semester-wise, testing understanding of concepts, problem-solving skills, and coding abilities. The pass percentage is generally above 80%. While the program is well-structured, some students may need extra help with advanced topics. Overall, TMU's B.Teach AI and ML program provides a solid foundation for a career in AI and ML.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the B.Teach AI and ML course at TMU for a career in artificial intelligence and machine learning. The best things about the course are the hands-on labs that help apply theoretical concepts and the knowledgeable faculty who provide decent support. One thing I wish would be better is improving industry connections for placements to enhance job opportunities. Regarding crowd and campus life, events are decent, and connectivity on campus is good.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA)
reviews.review_title: There are no good placements for finance and HR roles, but the faculty is good.

detailed_review.Placements: I got placed with the package of 5.4 LPA, but it was in sales. Most companies are for sale. The top recruiter is Wipro. 30-40% of students get the offer letter. We have to look for the internships ourselves, and mostly job roles, even from top recruiters, were from Salem.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good, but Wi-Fi doesn't work, and library books are not updated. Only 1 canteen, but the food is tasty. Parking problems for cars and no open area to play. The campus is small, so there is no campus life in TMIMT. Generally, there are no sports classes.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good at understanding and helpful, always ready to help. They teach through PPTs and take students on industrial visits to make them more skilled and to know the workings of industry. Exams are easy to do if you study well, and you can easily score 80%.

reviews.course: B.A. LL.B. (Hons.)
reviews.review_title: College campus is very good and eco-friendly.

detailed_review.Placements: College offers strong placement support with top recruiters like TCS, Infosys and Wipro. Regular training, mock interviews and internship opportunities help students gain confidence and industry exposure. Many students get placed in reputed firms.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is top notch with smart classrooms, modern labs and a digital library. Hostels are well-maintained, Wi-Fi-enabled and offer hygienic food. We have common rooms and study spaces that create a student friendly environment for both living and learning.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are knowledgeable, cooperative, and make learning easy with practical insights. The curriculum is updated, industry-relevant, and focuses on skill development. Exams are fair, well-planned, and test real understanding, not just written learning.
detailed_review.Other: Everything is good and very beautiful here.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Optometry (B.Optom.)
reviews.review_title: In 2025, good placement, really good infrastructure, and facilities are available.

detailed_review.Placements: About 75% of students get placed in the course. The package is Rs 23,000 per month to Rs 45,000 per month. Recruiting companies are Lenskart, Titan Eye Care, AIMS, Eye 7, and CL Gupta. 90% of students got internships. Top roles offered are optometrist, ophthalmic assistant, vision therapist, optical sales consultant, etc. It also provides international opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities are good. Infrastructure is also available. Every day 2 hour lab is compulsory. Classrooms are neat and clean. All books are available in library. Everything is available in hostel and students enjoy like home. Every day different type of food is served.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very knowledgeable and easily explain every topic. Teachers quality is outstanding. Teachers treat every student like their brother or sister. Curriculum makes students ready for the industry. Semester exams are not difficult. Pass percentage is 4.5 SGPA, and mostly students pass.
detailed_review.Other: I chose optometry because it combines my passion for healthcare with a deep interest in vision and how the eye works. My family member struggled with a vision problem that went undiagnosed for year, and it made me realise how essential vision is to daily life. It strengthens clinical training, updates the curriculum, focuses soft skills and entrepreneurship, and more industry and international exposure. Every week, events are organised and students enjoy and participate. Every event and fest is organised every year. Students are participating in a stroll activity, dance, etc. Campus is very good and every student is living in group and having fun. Scholarships are mostly awarded to students arrived, and every student is involved in an activity.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Radiological Imaging Techniques
reviews.review_title: Well-rounded college experience with supportive faculty, good placements, and strong infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Teerthankar Mahaveer University offers a wide variety of UG and PG courses across multiple streams, such as engineering, management, computer Science, law, education, and medical fields. The highest package is approximately 60 LPA in engineering and computer science-related stream. Top recruiting companies in health allied courses are Max Hospital, Fortis, Medanta, and Yathartha.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: TMU offers a broad range of modern facilities and infrastructure for students across all courses and departments, including robust academic, hostel, and recreational facilities like Wi-Fi, laboratories, classrooms, and a library. TMU features five student campus hostels (separate for boys and girls), accommodating up to 4,600 students. The hostels have 24/7 power backup, water purifiers, solar water heaters for hot water, and regular cleaning services.
detailed_review.Faculty: TMU is generally reviewed as having helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable teachers. Most faculty hold PG or doctoral degrees, and many have significant teaching and industry experience. Students consistently report that teachers are approachable, supportive, and skilled at explaining concepts while using a variety of teaching methods such as practical demonstration, projectors, and real-life examples.
detailed_review.Other: A wide range of career opportunities in radiology, a dynamic curriculum focused on emerging technologies in MRI, CT, and X-rays, and a blend of theory and hands-on learning.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Optometry (B.Optom.)
reviews.review_title: TMU - Growing hub for professional education.

detailed_review.Placements:
Around 70-80% of the students from the bachelor of optometry program are successfully placed through campus or off-campus recruitment drives. The highest package to the lowest package is 1.8 LPA - 6 LPA. Some of the well-known recruiters included Dr. Agarwal Eye Hospital 
Lenskart, Eye-Q Super Specialty Eye Hospital, and Apollo Hospital. Nearly 90-95% of students secured internships as part of their final year clinical training. Graduates are offered roles such as clinical optometrist, refractionist, vision therapist, optical store manager, and low vision specialist.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is well-structured, professional description of the facilities and infrastructure for the bachelor of optometry course at Teerthanker Mahaveer University (TMU), Moradabad including department and hostel amenities. Hostel facilities are decent and secure. Rooms are shared and are provided with basic furniture. Regular cleaning is done, but cleanliness may depend on individual blocks. The mess offers a variety of vegetarian meals, while food is hygienic.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in the Optometry department are generally well-qualified and knowledgeable in their respective areas. Teachers are approachable and helpful, especially during practical sessions, clinical postings, and exam preparation. The curriculum is fairly updated and aligned with industry standards. Semester exams are moderately challenging, they test both theoretical understanding and clinical knowledge. Students who attend classes regularly and practice well in labs usually find the exams manageable. Pass percentage typically ranges from 85% to 95% depending on the batch and subject.
detailed_review.Other: I chose optometry because I had a strong interest in eye care, vision science, and healthcare services. It could be improved like advanced equipment, more workshops, soft skills, counseling, and campus crowd.

reviews.course: B.Sc. (Hons.) in Agriculture
reviews.review_title: I thereby confirm that the above given review is true and mine.

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently 3rd year student, my seniors who have passed out from here have experienced great placement opportunities. So TMU is best for placements in any course. In our agricultural sciences, they are offering us jobs in different sectors with a good package.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: On my first day of TMU, I thought that the hostels would be messy and bad, but after seeing the hostel rooms, surroundings, and infrastructure, I am very happy with them. Using high-quality paint infrastructure, washrooms, and beds are great, and lifts are spacious and undergo regular checks.
detailed_review.Faculty: We have great faculty members, especially Kusum ma'am, from the horticulture department. She is very talented and experienced, good at assignments and teaching skills. Our faculty have done Ph. D.s in their special subjects. They are very friendly, possessive, and work-minded.
detailed_review.Other: In the current world, there are no farmers, all are consumers only, so for that reason, I want to become an agriculture student and related worker.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Optometry (B.Optom.)
reviews.review_title: Strong clinical exposure, good placements make TMU's optometry programme a solid choice.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 92% of students from the recent batch were placed, with the highest package reaching 8.5 LPA and an average package of 3.5 - 4 LPA. Top recruiters include Lenskart, Max Healthcare, and CK Birla Hospital. Over 700+ internship offers were made across TMU, with optometry students gaining hands-on experience in reputed hospitals and eye care centers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: TMU's optometry department offers modern classrooms, Wi-Fi-enabled labs, and access to a well-stocked library. Hostels are clean and secure, with decent food in the mess and canteen. Medical facilities are available on campus, along with sports and recreation areas.
detailed_review.Faculty: TMU's optometry teachers are qualified, supportive, and deliver practical, industry-relevant teaching. The curriculum blends theory with clinical exposure, preparing students well. Exams are moderately difficult, with a high pass rate of around 85-90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose optometry for its blend of healthcare and technology. The course offers strong clinical exposure and practical learning. TMU has vibrant fests, a friendly crowd, good connectivity, scholarships, and active extracurriculars.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Optometry (B.Optom.)
reviews.review_title: Well-rounded optometry experience at TMU with good academic and career support.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement cell is supportive, but I'd recommend students be proactive as well; building skills, attending workshops, and applying for internships on their own help a lot. Overall, the opportunities are there, and if you are focused and serious, TMU can help you get a good start in your career as an optometrist.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The university has good infrastructure with well-equipped labs, modern classrooms, and a dedicated eye hospital for clinical training. The campus is clean and student-friendly. Hostel facilities are decent, with clean rooms, good food, and proper security. There are common study areas, recreational rooms, and medical support available for students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are supportive and knowledgeable, and they focus on both theory and clinical skills. Exams are held regularly and are fair. The faculty makes sure we understand the theoretical concept clearly using examples, visuals, and interactive teaching methods. Practical sessions are handled with care.
detailed_review.Other: The university also organizes cultural, academic, and sports events regularly.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Optometry (B.Optom.)
reviews.review_title: It is the best place if students want to study and achieve success in their lives.

detailed_review.Placements: About 80% of students are successfully placed in hospitals and institutes. The further services will stop here. The package offered by my university ranges from 4- 50 LPA. Roles offered by my university are clinical optometrists, therapists, and paramedical doctors.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are good labs, classrooms, and a library for better studies. The hostel facilities are good. Good food is available in the canteen and mess. There are better sports facilities in my hostel and at the university too. Facilities provided by the university are much better. Some sports facilities are very relaxing for our minds.
detailed_review.Faculty: Good faculty members are available in my college, but the optometry faculty is more supportive. Faculty members in the college for this course are better suited to our career options. Some semesters are quite difficult, but in the medical profession, it is normal.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course to serve our country as a medical professional. I think projector classrooms and medical camps should be improved in my college.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Optometry (B.Optom.)
reviews.review_title: The college is well-structured and environmentally great. The campus is eco friendly.

detailed_review.Placements: The college offers strong placement support with top recruiters like TCS, Infosys and Wipro. Regular training, mock interviews and internship opportunities help students gain confidence and industry exposure. Many students get placed in reputed firms.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is top-notch with smart classrooms, modern labs, and a digital library. Hostels are well-maintained, Wi-Fi-enabled, and offer hygienic food. Common rooms and study spaces create a student-friendly environment for both living and learning.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are knowledgeable, cooperative, and make learning easy with practical insights. The curriculum is updated, industry-relevant, and focuses on skill development. Exams are fair, well-planned, and test real understanding, not just written learning.
detailed_review.Other: Everything is fine, the college is well-structured and environmentally friendly and the campus is good.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Optometry (B.Optom.)
reviews.review_title: Strong academics, good scope.

detailed_review.Placements: Optometry offers strong placement prospects, with 70–85% of students typically placed after graduation. The highest package ranges from ₹6–8 LPA, while the average is ₹3.5–4.5 LPA. Top recruiters include L. V. Prasad Eye Institute, Dr. Agarwal's Eye Hospital, Lenskart, Titan Eye+, and Vision Express. About 90–100% of students secure internships in hospitals, clinics, or optical retail chains. Popular roles include clinical optometrist, vision therapist, contact lens specialist, and low vision consultant. With the rising demand for eye care professionals in India, Optometry provides stable job opportunities in clinical, retail, and research sectors..
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Optometry department offers well-equipped labs, including refraction, low vision, contact lens, and dispensing labs. Classrooms are smart, air-conditioned, and Wi-Fi enabled. A central library provides access to textbooks, journals, and digital resources. Hostels have clean rooms, 24/7 water and electricity, and Wi-Fi. The mess and canteen serve hygienic, decent-quality food with both veg and non-veg options. Medical facilities include an on-campus clinic and tie-ups with hospitals. The campus has sports grounds, indoor games, and gym facilities, promoting student wellness. Overall, the infrastructure is student-friendly, modern, and supports both academic and personal growth for Optometry students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in the Optometry course are highly qualified, supportive, and experienced, often including practicing optometrists and guest faculty from reputed hospitals. Teaching quality is excellent, with a focus on practical skills, clinical exposure, and updated knowledge. The curriculum is industry-relevant, covering core areas like refraction, optics, pathology, and contact lenses, ensuring students are job-ready. Semester exams are moderately difficult, testing both theory and clinical application. Regular assessments and practicals help in better preparation. The pass percentage is high, generally around 85–95%, as students receive good academic support and hands-on training throughout the course.
detailed_review.Other: Our Optometry batch had a mix of passionate students from diverse backgrounds. I chose this course due to my interest in eye care and healthcare service, and its growing career scope. The best parts are clinical exposure, practical learning, and opportunities in hospitals and optical retail. Improvements can be made in research exposure and access to more advanced equipment. The campus hosts fests, cultural events, and academic seminars regularly. The crowd is friendly and focused. Good connectivity, scholarships, and a peaceful campus environment add value. Extracurricular activities and clubs promote overall personality development alongside academics.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Medical Lab Techniques
reviews.review_title: This is the best college with best faculty and best placements.

detailed_review.Placements: 70 of student are placed and as I am in 3rd semester, I have only this information. The lowest salary package offered is 2.5 LPA to 4 LPA, and the average salary offered varies from 4 LPA to 5.5 LPA. The highest salary package offered was 5.5 LPA to 8 LPA. Hospital diagnostic labs, research institutions and some companies like Apollo Hospital and Dr. Lal Path Lab offer placements. 70% of student got internships in hospitals and some companies. The roles offered are in blood bank, as technician, in research institutes, diagnostic labs and for research as scientists.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Medical laboratory department is the best department of the my college. Classroom, library and labs are safe for students. Also, we have Wi-Fi in the classrooms, library and labs. The best quality facilities are available of the hostels. We have hot and could water and recycling system also. The best and hygienic food is available in the mess and canteen. Medical facilities are available and we also have stadium for sports. The college also has indoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, best, qualified and knowledgeable. Teaching quality and practical skills are good. The course curriculum is relevant and students are directly ready for the industry work. There is some difficultly in the semester exams. The passing percentage is 45%. For each course, best teachers are available.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course to help people and to work in research institutions and diagnosis. This is the best course for paramedical courses. I think the lab conditions should be better for this course and for laboratory technicians because laboratory technicians are the backbone of the medical field. So, they should improve the condition of these. There is a crowd on campus. Campus events and fests are held from time to time. Scholarship programs are available.

reviews.course: B.Sc. (Hons.) in Agriculture
reviews.review_title: TMU is absolutely a good college.

detailed_review.Placements: Teerthanker Mahaveer University is a good university. There is an 80% chance for students to get placements. The college has a placement cell, and many companies offer placements. Companies are not only Indian companies, but are also outside India. I suggest students choose this college for their B.Sc. (Hons.) in Agriculture course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In TMU, the infrastructure and facilities are good. There is Wi-Fi, and classrooms have air-conditioners. The hostel is good, and it serves good quality food. It has all kinds of equipment for practical and also has laboratories for practical experiments. I suggest students should get admission to this college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are helpful and well-qualified. They have full knowledge of agriculture. Teachers are knowledgeable. They solve all doubts related to the course. Semester exams are both hard and easy. Teachers teach us all questions and answers that come in exams.
detailed_review.Other: It is a good university and one of the best universities in India, so I chose this university.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Radiological Imaging Techniques
reviews.review_title: The college infrastructure and facilities are good. It has an awesome teaching staff.

detailed_review.Placements: 70 percent of students secure placement from our college. The average package ranges between 6-7 LPA. The lowest package ranges from 3-4 LPA. The college provides placements in companies like Wipro, Paytm, and some other selected companies with the opportunity of internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is well-designed with spacious and well-ventilated classrooms. It has advanced technology-equipped labs which incorporate the latest technology. The college has a good library, offering a wide range of resources for research and study.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college faculty members are very good and experienced. Faculty members provide detailed knowledge of the subject and make students aware of all other matters related to the subject. Most teachers are helpful and take extra time if students don't understand a topic.
detailed_review.Other: The college events are always memorable. It organises great fests.

reviews.course: B.Sc. (Hons.) in Agriculture
reviews.review_title: It has good academic support and labs, but poor hostel life and mess facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: The college offers a strong foundation in agricultural sciences with practical exposure to fieldwork, research labs, and farm training. The placement cell actively connects students with companies in agribusiness, seed industries, agri-input, food processing, and research institutions.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Agriculture department is well-equipped for academic and practical learning. The department has specialised labs for Soil Science, Agronomy, Plant Pathology, Genetics, and Horticulture. Wardens are generally unhelpful and not very responsive to student concerns. The quality of food in the mess is below average. Meals are repetitive, and often lack proper nutrition, and hygiene standards need serious improvement. Wardens are generally unhelpful and not very responsive to student concerns.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are approachable and supportive. Teachers are well-qualified, holding M.Sc. or PhD degrees in their respective fields. The course curriculum is designed as per ICAR guidelines and covers a wide range of subjects like Agronomy, Horticulture, Soil Science, Plant Breeding, Agri-Economics, and Plant Pathology. On average, the pass percentage is around 85-90%, as long as students attend classes and put in consistent effort.

reviews.course: B.Sc. (Hons.) in Agriculture
reviews.review_title: The college has a good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: It provides good placements. 85% of students get placed in the 2024 season. The highest package offered is 60 LPA. College of Agriculture Sciences at TMU invites companies like Norex Flavour Private Limited, Dhampur Sugar Mills, Syngenta Foundation, Zeneva Crop Science, and BASF India for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms infrastructure is good and ventilated. Labs are also well-maintained. Wi-Fi has a a little bit issues. The canteen needs improvement, and food should be made in a more hygienic way. Other facilities are good. The college campus is full of greenery and good vibes.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very supportive, helpful and knowledgeable. They teach in a very firm way, with both bookish knowledge and practical experience in the field. The course curriculum is the best, and it provides exposure to various fields, including marketing, business, etc.

reviews.course: B.Sc. (Hons.) in Agriculture
reviews.review_title: It offers an ICAR-accredited course with strong academics and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 85% of B.Sc in Agriculture students at TMU get placed or internships. Top roles are offered in horticulture and field research. The average package is 5 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course include Jubilant, Genpact, and international internship programs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: B.Sc. (Hons.) in Agriculture department at TMU offers Wi-Fi-enabled smart classrooms, well-equipped labs (soil science, agronomy, horticulture), a dedicated agricultural research farm and a central library. Hostels have decent facilities, clean rooms, Wi-Fi, 24x7 medical support, nutritious mess food, and good sports infrastructure including fields and indoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers for B.Sc in Agriculture at TMU are helpful and well-qualified. Many teachers are PhD holders. They are knowledgeable. The course curriculum is ICAR-aligned, practical-oriented, and industry-relevant. Exams are moderately difficult with good preparation. The pass percentage is generally above 85%.
detailed_review.Other: Teerthanker Mahaveer University B.Sc. (Hons.) in Agriculture (2023-2027) offers ICAR-accredited and industry-liked education with strong academic support, though more hands-on exposure and agri-focused events could improve the experience. I chose B.Sc. (Hons.) in Agriculture at TMU because of my interest in sustainable farming and agri-sciences. The best parts are the practical exposure, farm training, and experienced faculty members. I wish the on-campus placements and industry tie-ups were stronger.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Forensic Science
reviews.review_title: It has supportive academics and internships. It lack placements, field work, and practical exposure.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a B.Sc. in Forensic Science student (2024-2027). The course provides good theory and practical exposure through internships. However, placements are currently limited in our field. Only a few students get placed in labs or private firms. The package offered ranges from 5-6 LPA. Many students prepare for exams like CBI, NIA, CFSL, and FSL. TMU should strengthen ties with forensic labs and agencies. More career guidance, interview training, and placement drives are needed. Industry tie-ups can greatly improve student outcomes.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are clean and projectors are available. There are no smart boards. Wi-Fi is available and works well for study purposes. The library has many books, but very few forensic science books. In 1st year, we could not even find fundamentals of Forensic Science by B. R. Sharma. Forensic labs are there, but many instruments are outdated or missing. TMU Hospital gives good medical help anytime. The canteen is good. Sports grounds and events are available. There should be a visit to real crime scenes.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most teachers are friendly, helpful, and explain topics well when we ask. They are well-qualified and have good subject knowledge. Teaching quality is good overall. Some use video and real examples, which really helps. Still, more field-based teaching would make it better. The syllabus covers major forensic topics and is well-structured. But it lacks real crime scene exposure. The course alone does not make us fully job-ready. Most students prepare for higher studies or government exams. We need more practical training, internships, and soft skills. Semester exams are manageable. The pass percentage is high.
detailed_review.Other: I am from B.Sc. in Forensic Science (2024-2027). I chose this course because it is exciting, as it includes Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Law, Ballistics, etc., and helps in delivering justice. The library lacks basic forensic books like B. R. Sharma's. Labs are outdated, and we need better equipment and real field visits. Being a professional dancer, I feel multi-talented students deserve more events and support. Campus is peaceful, but more academic and cultural events are needed. Only a few students are shown again on TMU's Instagram, and others do not get a chance. With some improvements, the experience can be amazing.

college_info.college_name: TMU Course Admission 2025: Dates, Fee, Eligibility & Selection Criteria

faqs.question: What is the TMU BTech fee?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee for TMU BTech course ranges between INR 2.4 lakh - INR 5.6 lakh . The fee is calculated based on the semester tuition fee. Aspirants need to confirm their seats with TMU BTech fee. In case an aspirant is unable to pay the course fee, his or her admission stands canceled. Apart from the course fee, candidates need to pay a registration fee in the start of the admission process. Candidates need to pay a non-refundable application fee of INR 1,000 via online or offline payment mode.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for TMU admission?
faqs.answer: Candidates who qualifies the eligibility criteria are eligible for the cousres offered at TMU. Find below course-wise eligibility criteria: Class 12 with Physics, Maths & Chemistry (or Computer Science) with a minimum of 50% aggregate and passing marks in English + JEE Main score Class 12 with at least 50% aggregate in PCB and pass marks in English+ NEET score Graduation in any stream with at least 50% aggregate + MAT/CAT/CMAT+ PI Class 12 with Mathematics at Class 10 level with at least 50% aggregate Class 12 Class 12 in any stream with at least 50% aggregate *This information is sourced from the official website/ sanctioning body and is subject to change.

faqs.question: Is JEE required for Teerthanker Mahaveer University?
faqs.answer: Yes, JEE Main or UPCET score is required for admission to Bachelor of Technology courses at Teerthanker Mahaveer University. The university accepts national-level entrance exams like CUET-UG, JEE Main, UPCET, etc. Eligibility criteria: A pass in Class 12 with Physics, Maths & Chemistry (or Computer Science) with a minimum of 50% aggregate and passing marks in English is required to apply for BTech courses at TMU.

faqs.question: How can I apply for MBBS in TMU?
faqs.answer: The mode of application is both online and offline. The application form can be submitted with a demand draft of INR 1,000 at Teerthanker Mahaveer University, Moradabad in offline mode. Check below the steps to apply for TMU BCA admission via online mode: Step 1: Visit the official website. Step 2: Click on ‘Apply’ on the Home page. Step 3: Read the instructions and register with the basic details. Step 4: Login and fill out the application form. Step 5: Upload the documents and pay the application fee. Step 6: Submit and print the application form. Documents required at the time of application

faqs.question: What is the BSc seat intake at TMU?
faqs.answer: The overall seat intake at Teerthanker Mahaveer University is  800. The BSc seats are unevenly distributed among the BSc (Hons) specialisations. Find the BSc seat bifurcation of BSc programme: *This information is sourced from the official website/ sanctioning body and is subject to change.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in TMU for BSc in Agriculture?
faqs.answer: TMU admission to BSc (Hons) Agriculture is based on merit in the last qualifying exam. The university also accepts CUET-UG score for admission to BSc (Hons) Agriculture. Candidates need to complete intermediate/ Class 12 with PCM/ PCB/ PCMB/ Agriculture with at least 50% aggregate to apply for BSc (Hons) Agriculture course. facilities.name: Library
facilities.description:
The central library was established in the year 2008, it is situated on the fifth floor of the Medical College & Research Centre and occupies 2560 sq. m. area along with Central library, and University maintains well stocked separate libraries for each of its colleges and faculties. 

These libraries have more than one lakh books on varied subjects and have subscription to print version of 396 national and international journals besides access to a host of e-journals. 

The University has subscribed the ClinicalKey, DELNET, EBSCOhost and maupatra data base providing access to full text research articles and sector specific reports in different disciplines.

facilities.name: Cafeteria
facilities.description: Besides central Mess facilities each college of the University has spacious and well maintained canteen as well as Talk-of-the-Town and VIP Pizza Restaurant providing the students with the choicest of hygienic and delicious Indian, Chinese and Italian dishes. These spots have become essentially centres of learning beyond class rooms.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description:
The University houses five hostels in its campus- 2 for boys and 3 for girls with a capacity to accommodate 4600 students.The hostel rooms are spacious, clean, and well maintained with attached bathrooms. The rooms are available on single occupancy basis as well as on sharing basis. To help the young minds focus on their studies, each room is furnished with beds, wardrobes, study tables, chairs and air-cooler. Solar heaters have been installed in all the hostels to supply hot water conserving electricity. Water purifiers and water coolers are installed to provide potable water. Round the clock power back-up helps students to study without interruption.

Air-conditioned rooms are also available to meet specific requirement of the students. Each hostel has a visitor’s room, a spacious well lit common room with a large screen television and comfortable seating arrangement, recreational facilities, equipments for indoor games, newspapers and magazines, Wi-Fi connectivity and a gymnasium. Laundry facility is available in-house with commercial washing machine and tumbler drier. Spacious dining rooms and modern kitchens ensure that students are served with nutritious food in a good ambiance.

A dedicated team of wardens and caretakers helps and resolve the problems of the boarders. Students are advised to comply with rules and regulations of the University hostels.

facilities.name: Sports Complex
facilities.description:
Besides sports facilities various sports labs like Anatomy, physiology & health education. Human performance, Physiotherapy, Athletic Care & Rehabilitation and Sports Psychology Laboratory. Outdoor are also in place in the University.

In order to attract and reward the talented sports persons as well as enhance the standards of sports, sports scholarship is being offered for the various programs being offered in the University except a few. For details refer to the scholarship policy of the University.

The University has a Cricket stadium and pavilion par excellence. Twenty turf wickets of the University comply with the international standards and have hosted prestigious tournaments like Ranaji Trophy and Cooch Behar Tournament.

There is a football field in the campus which recently witnessed the participation of eighteen teams in Inter Region Football Championship leading to selections in the prestigious Santosh Trophy.

There are facilities for kho-kho, hockey and kabaddi.

Facilities for combative sports are in place in the University.

Sports facilities for track and field athletics are available in the University which are used for daily training as well as for staging regional or local competitions. There is a 400m standard track used for athletics.

college_info.college_name: LNMIIT: Cutoff 2025, Placements, Courses, Fees, Admissions 2025

highlights.summary:
The LNM Institute of Information Technology was founded in 2002 as a joint venture of the Government of Rajasthan and Lakshmi and Usha Mittal Foundation. The institute got the recognition of Deemed to be University status in 2006. According to the India Today ranking 2025, the institute is ranked 45 in the BTech category. It is a grade 'A' accredited institute (Given by NAAC).
LNMIIT Jaipur courses are offered to students at the UG, PG, and PhD levels. The institute offers seven engineering courses like BTech, BTech (Hons), BTech-MTech Integrated, MTech, MS by Research, MSc and PhD in 6 departments. These courses are offered in 26 specialisations such as Computer Science and Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Mechanical-Mechatronics Engineering, Mathematics, Physics and Humanities & Social Sciences. LNMIIT course admissions are conducted on the basis of both merit and entrance test.
The highest package offered during LNMIIT placement 2025 was INR 124 LPA. The institute facilitates students with library, auditorium, seminar or conference halls, guest houses, internet & Wi-Fi, hostels, and canteen, among others. The major highlights of the LNMIIT are tabulated below:
Rupa ki Nangal, Post-Sumel, Via-Jamdoli, Jaipur, Rajasthan
All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Government of Rajasthan
IBM, Infosys, Wipro, Amazon, HDFC Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank
Check out more on LNMIT Highlights in the below videos:

table.details: Rupa ki Nangal, Post-Sumel, Via-Jamdoli, Jaipur, Rajasthan
All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Government of Rajasthan
IBM, Infosys, Wipro, Amazon, HDFC Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank

The flagship courses offered at LNM Institute of Information Technology are BTech and MTech, etc. LNMIIT offers seven courses in six departments and 26 specialisations some of which are CS and Engineering, ECE, Mathematics, and Humanities and Social Sciences.
The most popular course offered at LNMIIT is BTech for 4 years. It is offered in Mechanical Engineering, CS & Engineering, ECE, Electrical & Electronics Engineering, CSE (Cyber Security), Electronics Engineering (VLSI Design & Technology), IT, Artificial Intelligence & Data Science, and CS & Business Systems.
