LNMIIT Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Fine college to take admission if you want a good campus and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: My batch was fine, i.e., Y23. The placements were average. The thing is, the college provides 100 percent placement on the website, but only some of the students are applicable to sit on placements. It does not include those who are not applicable, whose CGPA is less. And don't expect ECE core companies; there are too few.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: When it comes to the hostels, the college is pretty good. Hostel BH4 is newly built and even has AC facilities and is in new condition. Facility-wise, the college is decent. Wi-Fi is available in every hostel; one girls' hostel is there, and there are five boys' hostels, including one more newly built hostel, which is small, BH5.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is pretty hard if you are in the ECE branch. If you are taking this college, you will have to study. Some professors are strict, while some are lenient. There is pretty strict marking too. But professors are helpful; the curriculum sometimes is irrelevant. Many students do not fail.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Communication and Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of LNM Institute of Information Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are decent, the average package right now is 10 LPA, which is good. We do have on-campus placements, and we have a dedicated training and placement cell, but overall, the average package has dropped, as it was around 14 LPA in 2022, but now it is just 10 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure at college is good, we have all sorts of labs, and we have enough hostels for students, but most of the hostels are not well maintained. Other issues are water disruption on a weekly basis, and only a few hostels have Wi-Fi facilities. We have air ducts in most of the hostels and AC in some.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members are well qualified, and most of them are encouraging of hackathons and competitions. Curriculum is a bit hectic, but it is updated and aligned according to industry. The exams are difficult, and it is hard to score and get good grades when compared to other colleges.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: LNMIIT is worth the fee.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80-85% of students get placed in this course. The highest package is 40 LPA for ECE and 1.3 crores for CSE. The average package is 13 LPA with a median of 12 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Samsung, BNY, Adobe, and MakeMyTrip. I do my first internship as a first-year student in a data analytics role in a company in offline mode. In my course, most students get placed, some in core and some in tech-related jobs. ECE is diverse and divided into various domains like robotics, AI/ML, automation, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The department infrastructure is good, and a new building solely for AI is under development. Wi-Fi and LAN facilities are available. Labs are well-equipped and have industry-based software and hardware. The library has three halls and a separate hall with PCs. It also has a noise-cancellation media room for shoots. Hostel facilities are average. Boys’ Hostel 4 has ACs and other facilities, but other hostels lack proper renovation and amenities. The quality of food is good compared to other colleges. The canteen area is small with limited options. Medical facilities are free for all and available 24/7.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are available after class hours in their cabins to solve student queries. Students can also reach out to faculty through email. All teachers are well-qualified with PhDs and Masters from IITs and other renowned colleges, with high levels of experience. The course curriculum is a bit basic at the start, but by semester 3, it focuses on company requirements and practical knowledge. The curriculum is very challenging, and grading is strict. Passing is absolute, but grading is relative.
detailed_review.Other: Choosing ECE was not by choice, but as I pursue the course, I realize that 90 percent of students opt for tech-related jobs, leaving less competition in core. The starting package in core is lower compared to tech, but job stability is higher. If one is interested in electronics, they should definitely consider this option. LNMIIT is known for its coding culture. We are exposed to advanced coding from the start, making it easier to secure more job offers. Fests are great and fun.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is good, but it comes with a cost.

detailed_review.Placements: This year, 92 percent of students got placed. The highest package is more than 1 crore off campus, the average is 13.8 LPA, and the lowest is 12.2 LPA. Google came to our college to recruit students. The main internship is off-campus, so we don't know much. Top roles offered are software developer, blockchain architect, and many more. As I don't know much, but some people got a post in finance also.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Well, the academic area, library, and labs are clean and maintained with the best equipment and supplies. The hostels are good with internet, but we have to clean our rooms ourselves. Mess food is good, but this hostel is in a forest, so there are many animals and insects to be aware of.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are hard to understand but highly proficient and qualified with degrees from their own and foreign universities. The curriculum is relevant as it changes every 3 years again, and it is difficult for many people to fail in many subjects. Well, you need to study to get a good grade; otherwise, stay here in the summer.
detailed_review.Other: Fests are good, vivacity is speaking, and some relation in grading would be good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Really good infrastructure and college life.

detailed_review.Placements: As placement year has just started and it's just the start only, already 240 students are placed out of around 450 students, and I am talking about on-campus placement. Still, there is the whole year left, so I think it's a very good number. In this college, getting an on-campus placement is easy because competition is less since the number of students in a batch is only 600–650, and around 500 sit for the placement.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It's quite good, like you have all the basic requirements, but wardens are quite strict, which is a downgrade. Otherwise, everything is good, and the food is also good compared to other colleges. Wi-Fi is good, the speed is very good, but we have to log in again and again every 3 hours.
detailed_review.Faculty: Academics are very tough here; maintaining a good CG here is very hard. Above 7 CG here is considered very good. Professors are very strict at checking the papers, if the answer is fully correct then only they'll give marks, else zero, so this is a major downgrade. But the faculty is good, they teach well, and they provide the notes PDF in the classroom app, which is very helpful in case engineering students go to attend classes. 75 percent attendance is must here, so only to maintain the attendance we have to go.
detailed_review.Other: The best crowd I could have got, no ragging, only interaction that's on your will, very supportive seniors, good student unity. If the crowd is less, you can have a good college life here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college for CS for 97-98 percent in JEE Main.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement percentage of registered students is about 93% (varies slightly year to year). The highest package is almost always an off-campus offer. This year, it is about 1.4 crores. Always compare median packages of colleges though. The median for 4-year CSE hovers around 13 LPA while the average is a bit higher, about 14.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Central library is top-notch in terms of the study environment it provides, and the vast availability of all course related books. Only con is that it shuts down at 10:00 PM. In boys hostel, 4 rooms are spacious and common areas are also clean most of the time. Wi-Fi speed is good but you need to login after 3 hours every time so it gets a little annoying.
detailed_review.Faculty: Curriculum is almost exactly copied from IIT Kanpur. Teachers are quite qualified but their teaching is average at best. Grading in this college is very strict. Maintaining a good CGPA is quite a task in this college, giving you less time for non-academic stuff.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the infrastructure, events, and academics.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 85 percent of the students are placed in our course. The highest package is 1.24 crore, the lowest package is 3.5 LPA, and the average package is 13.87 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Google India, Deloitte, Amazon, Uber, Oyo, Microsoft, etc. Approximately 72 percent of students got internships in our B.Tech course at Google, Microsoft, Flipkart, etc. Top roles offered to B.Tech graduates at LNMIIT Jaipur are in software development, data science, cybersecurity, and related technology fields.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: LNMIIT Jaipur offers good quality facilities. The infrastructure is also well-maintained. The quality of Wi-Fi that is offered in the college and hostel is very good. The speed of the Wi-Fi is approximately 150 Mbps. Labs in our college are very clean, hygienic, and well-maintained. Classrooms are very clean, well-furnished, and very huge. The library facility offered by our college is very good and well-furnished, and includes various types of books. We have different genres of books as well. There are various facilities available in our hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at LNMIIT Jaipur are well-educated and certified. They are very helpful. Their knowledge is very sharp and useful. Their teaching style is also very good and very precise. The course curriculum is relevant. Industry in this course is very big and very relevant for the future. Semester exams are sometimes difficult, and sometimes easy to score marks. The pass percentage of every course is approximately 40 percent.
detailed_review.Other: Course is very good for the future. This course also includes a very big industry. I also have an interest in this course. The quality of teaching by some of the professors should be improved by the time. The events happening in our college are very joyful.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements tough academics great college life and great exposure decent infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: 90 percent of the students are placed. The highest package is 1.25 crores and the lowest package is 4 to 5 LPA. There are students who are unplaced. Top Recruiting companies are Deloitte Goldman Sachs. 50 percent of students got off campus internships like internships are basically offcampus, and most of the good placements and high placements are off campus. I am a B.Tech Computer Science Engineering student and I am trying to learn new things and there is a lot of exposure in this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are great in this college with great labs and a very good central library. The classes are also decent with good Air conditioning but only 2 out of 5 hostels are good. The hostel facility is old like the most famous hostel and the best hostel on campus is BH4 with a TT table and a badminton net with a night canteen and a mess inside. They started a laundry system in 2025 otherwise the other hostels are just not worth the hype, other hostels are like a jail with no AC.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is great in terms of knowledge. Teaching they are up to other college levels where teachers just say their things and the student tries to understand all by their hard work. There is a midterm endterm and quiz system in college. There are no internals and assignment marks. The lab contains marks for assignments. I do not think it is at that level that the industry requires like in the first year we basically study PCM with C language and then the real course starts from the 2nd year. Passing percentages are good but CG maintenance is hard.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this college as it is great for Computer Science and Engineering. I am dissatisfied It is not upto what I was thinking initially They should not be strict about marking and should give students freedom to have a balance of personal and academics life Maintain a good CG is really tough in this college There are 3 fests in this college and the campus is around 100 acres for your understanding around 1 km long campus there is a lot of exposure as soo many clubs and events are going everyday.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Academic pressure, infrastructure, and fees.

detailed_review.Placements: 90 percent of the eligible students get placed on campus here, with an average package of 13 LPA and a similar median. Mass recruitments are not permitted here. The lowest package offered is 8 LPA. Most people get placed in tech roles, even from non-CS branches.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure here is below average. Water gets logged in corridors even after a drizzle. Lecture theaters are old and still have green boards and projectors. First-level medical facilities are nice and available every time. Mess food is edible. Wi-Fi is provided everywhere, but you need to log in again every 3 hours. The AI center building is under construction and hopefully will be something of its own.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified and knowledgeable, and most of them are helpful. The curriculum was last updated in 2023 and looks fair to me. Academics here are considered tough and stressful in general, as quizzes, assignments, and activities occur throughout the semester.
detailed_review.Other: I have an interest in electronics. I like the course as it is. Three fests are hosted here. The campus is 20 km from Jaipur in a rural area.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: LNMIIT: Fests of a private college but facilities of a government college.

detailed_review.Placements: Many students can't give interviews because of low CGPA. Those who give interviews can get a decent package. Top companies are Deloitte, DeShaw, BNY Melon, IBM, Zomato, the highest package is around 30 LPA, and the average package is around 13 LPA. Internship opportunities are very less. Around 30% of students can get internships from this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: By a private college level, the college facility is below par. The labs, classrooms, and library are good, though I would say the library is small for the number of admissions. Hostels are very bad. The duct system does not give any cooling, and washrooms are always dirty, the gym is very small, so it is always crowded, and machines are also not in working condition.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some faculty members are good, but the courses are very hard. Exams are also very tough to pass, the course curriculum is relevant, but the exams are very difficult, so it is very tough to attain a good CGPA. Some teachers are very helpful and can guide you very well, while others can be very hard on you.
detailed_review.Other: If you are getting any other NITs or IITs, please save your parents' money and do not opt for this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Facilities are not up to the mark according to the fees which we pay.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 85% students get placed. The companies are Google, Microsoft, Intuit, Media.net, AMD, Samsung, BNY Mellon, OYO, and Deloitte. The highest package is 1.28 crore, the lowest package is around 6 LPA, and the average is around 13.8 LPA. In 3rd year, the internship companies start and almost every student achieves one.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is not present in some hostels, but they provide LAN facility. Labs are nice, they have AC and good systems. Classrooms are good. Libraries are great, they have almost every book you need, with a great sitting area, and you can issue any book you want. The main food quality is not up to the mark compared to the fees. Good sports facilities like basketball, volleyball, and almost every sport are present. They have a good medical facility or medical room and provide medicine for diseases. The canteen is good and almost everything is available in the canteen.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are highly qualified and well-educated. They are kind and helpful, and after class, they also clear your doubts. The course is relevant. It teaches the overall development of the student. The exams are very difficult, and most students fail in the exams. It is very hard to get a good CG in this college.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this college because of the coding culture. The course can be improved by introducing some placement-oriented subjects. Events are good, and the campus crowd is also good as they have JEE Main as the cutoff for selection.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great placement opportunities but disappointing facilities and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: 85.11% of students got placed last year. The highest package is 1.24 crore per year, the lowest is around 6 LPA, and the average is around 13.87 LPA. Top recruiters include Goldman Sachs, Eat Club, Google, Microsoft, Intuit, Media.net, Flipkart, AMD, BNY Mellon, OYO, Samsung, Deloitte, and almost every big MNC. Top roles offered are Data Analyst, AI/ML Engineer, Software Engineer, and MS.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is not available in one hostel, but they provide LAN connectivity. Facilities are good. Labs have great systems and AC. Classrooms are fine. The library is very good, with nice seating, well-managed, and has all kinds of books. In some hostels, AC and Wi-Fi are available, while others have duct and LAN ports. Sports are great. Almost every sport is present in the college. The gym is also there. Mess food is not up to the mark compared to the fees they charge. They have a decent medical facility, and the canteen is good; you can find almost everything you want to eat.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and highly qualified. Every teacher has done a Ph.D. from either IITs or foreign universities. The course curriculum is very relevant to current placement opportunities. They teach everything that can help in placements. The exams are slightly difficult, and many students fail. The pass percentage depends on the subject, but many students fail the exam.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I have interest in coding, and this college has a great coding culture and placements. Mess food must be improved, and ducts should be replaced with ACs. Fests and events are great. They call top artists like Seedhe Maut, Raftaar, Darshan Raval, etc.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: LNMIIT Jaipur is a great college with some minor faults at its core.

detailed_review.Placements:
Overall, I can say that Placements in my college are not perfect but are decent enough as we get to have placements from companies like DE Shaw, Google, Adobe, Delottie, Uber, Ola and many more.
If we talk about placement statistics for students who were eligible to sit in, they have generally got a placement at the end, around 85% - 90% 
The highest placement last year was 52 LPA from DE Shaw.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel facilities in my college were below average in BH-1,2,3. The best hostel at my campus is BH-4, in which we had proper air conditioning with good space in rooms, along with Wi-Fi Connections available on all 6 floors, but other hostels did not have AC, while they have ducts which do not work as well as AC but do the work.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some faculty members of courses offered are the best with great knowledge and proper understanding of the course they teach, as usual, some faculty members are here just to make a buck, and I feel they do not tend to have eagerness towards teaching students, rather, they focus on completing the syllabus. Some good faculty members in my branch are Dr Admit Neogi, Dr Ashish Kumar Dwiwedi, MS Rajbir, and MS Preety Singh.
detailed_review.Other: The reason for choosing the semi-private college over some old, reputed government college was due to its coding environment and placement statistics. There are 3 fests that are conducted from Jan to mid-Feb every year, of which Vivacity (Cultural Fest ) is the best. We've hosted artists like Raftaar, Sees Kaur, and Admit Trivedi. Darshan Rawal, Seedhe Maut and many more over the past years.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and decent placements with supportive faculty

detailed_review.Placements: 92% of students are placed. The median package is around 12 LPA, while the highest varies every year from 1.2 crores to 70 LPA. Major companies like Google, Facebook, Meta, Dell, and all other known companies visit our campus every year. Common roles include software engineers, data analysts, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Well-equipped classrooms, decent-speed Wi-Fi, a modern lab, and a central library with both physical and digital resources. Hostels are comfortable with basic amenities. The mess provides hygienic and decent food, and there are canteens for extra options. Medical facilities are available on campus, along with sports grounds and courts for physical activities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and qualified. The course curriculum is regularly updated and includes industry-relevant topics, internships, and projects, helping students become job-ready. Semester exams are moderately difficult and focus on both theory and application.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: A very satisfactory experience. The campus is also expanding.

detailed_review.Placements: My branch is ECE (Electronics and Communication Engineering). Around 85% of students who apply for placements get on-campus placements each year. The average package is 11.65 LPA, and the highest being around 47 LPA as of 2024. Some of the top recruiting companies are Microsoft, Google, Intuit, Flipkart, AMD, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are very decent compared to other colleges. Central AC facilities and some hostels even have AC facilities. Sports ground for football, cricket, basketball courts, jogging track, etc. The food is also very decent and the campus is covered with greenery all around making it a serene environment to walk in. Classrooms and libraries are also very comfortable to study in.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are decent. Teaching is nice, and feedback is taken after every semester to improve the quality of education. The curriculum is better than many NITs and IITs, and practical skills are taught from the very first year with remarkable knowledgeable project opportunities.
detailed_review.Other: The events and fests are solely organized by students, which is great to enhance leadership qualities among operation, management, accountability, and other skills. The course offers a multitude of options, being a connection between the mechanical and CSE branches, offering insights on multiple aspects of both courses.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Positive: Flexible course with good opportunities to teach. Balanced course with decent placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Batch: 2021-2025, B.Teach in electronics and communication engineering. About 80% of registered students placed. The highest package offered was 45 LPA. The average package stood at 10 LPA and the lowest package was at 14 LPA. The major roles were embedded systems, software development, and VLSI design. Overall the placements were good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has dedicated labs for each course of the branch. Labs are equipped with essential instruments. The campus is completely equipped with Wi-Fi in all the areas. Classrooms are equipped with projectors and audio systems. The library is well-stocked with technical books and journals. Hostels are decent with double and single occupancy good Wi-Fi connectivity and centralized air conditioning. Mess food is quite good and the canteens are open till midnight. The medical center is on the campus with a presidential doctor. Sports complex with cricket, football ground, tennis and badminton court.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-qualified and knowledgeable. Many professors have completed their PhD's from IIT's and IISc's. Many are also actively involved in research areas. Most faculty are approachable and supportive when needed. The course curriculum is well structured and is updated regularly to align with the industry standards.
detailed_review.Other: The college has a peaceful, green campus with a vibrant student community. Events like Vivacity (cultural fest), Plinth (TechFest), TEDx, and E-Summit are highlights of campus life. There is strong participation in clubs, hackathons, and sports. The campus is located slightly outside Jaipur but the college provides regular bus service to the main city.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: College Insights LNMIIT.

detailed_review.Placements: About 85% of students are placed according to the college website. The average package is around 12.78 LPA and the median stays at about 10 LPA. Major companies are Google, Amazon, Flipkart, Deloitte, and Goldman Sachs. Off-campus placements are also good enough.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Lecture halls and the library have good infrastructure, and the library contains books from every domain, although it is not big enough. Wi-Fi facility is available everywhere, including in lecture halls, hostels, the library, etc. Labs are good quality equipment and are well furnished too. Sports facilities are good and well maintained. The mess and canteen areas are clean and tidy. Bus facilities are available for students who want to travel to the city, as the college is located on the outskirts rather than in the city.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, highly qualified professionals, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is okayish and may vary from person to person. The curriculum is vast and diverse. Academics at this college are not that easy as when compared to other colleges, so one needs to be serious about quizzes and exams conducted.
detailed_review.Other: There are three fests organized by this college, namely Plinth, Vivacity, and Desportivos. The crowd is good, and the coding culture of this college is not that bad.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: LNMIIT: The Best Private College for Your Child?

detailed_review.Placements: This year, the highest package was given to a CSE student, and it was 52 LPA. Top companies are Adobe, Microsoft, Samsung India, among others. Most of the students get placed either on-campus or off-campus. Most roles include software engineer and even some managerial positions.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In the hostels, LAN is made available in each room. Bathrooms are cleaned regularly and very nicely. Labs and classrooms are equipped with state-of-the-art equipment. The library has all kinds of books. The mess is managed by vendors who also handle the mess facilities for IIT Kanpur and IIT Delhi.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are highly professional and qualified. Most of them are doctorates, having done their Ph.D. from renowned institutes. The course curriculum is relevant and updated regularly to keep up with the requirements of students. The exams are difficult, but if you pay attention in the classes, they are quite scorable.
detailed_review.Other: This college has an excellent coding culture. The seniors here are very helpful and knowledgeable.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfactory college but didn't meet my expectations. It is good.

detailed_review.Placements: The last batch that was passed out and got placed in this course was 80.7%. The highest salary package offered is 52.29 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is around 6 LPA. The average salary package offered is around 10 LPA - 12.51 LPA. Approximately 25% of students cracked internships at various companies like Google, Delloite, Scale, etc. Top roles offered are product manager and SDE.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the basic necessities are available on the campus. All lecture theatres are fully air-conditioned. The library and all labs are also air-conditioned. Double occupancy rooms are available for first, second, and third-year students. Fourth-year students get single rooms. All outdoor sports like cricket, football, volleyball, basketball, lawn tennis, badminton, kabaddi, etc., are available on the campus. We have a canteen in the middle of the campus which has more than 10 shops and cafes to fulfill daily needs. A doctor is available 24/7 on the campus. There is an ambulance for emergencies. The mess food is above average. All hostels, labs lecture theatres, and a library have Wi-Fi connections.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are highly qualified and helpful. They also provide projects and internships under them to toppers. The course curriculum gets updated regularly according to industry needs. Semester exams here are a little bit on the difficult side but for someone who studies daily. It's doable. The pass percentage in most subjects is 99%. In a few subjects, it is 95% approximately.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of The LNM Institute of Information Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements at our college are nice. There is a placement officer in our college who invites companies for placements. Top recruiting companies are Media.net and ArcelorMittal. The highest salary package offered in 2024 is 40 LPA. The average salary package offered is 13 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 5 LPA. The role offered by companies is an SDE product manager. If students have a good pointer and good skillset, they can get placed in our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is average. The college is spread over approximately 60 acres of working area. The rest is covered with trees. The hostel facility at our college is nice. Every room is air-conditioned. 24/7 Wi-Fi is available at our college. The mess and canteens are average. Students don't have many food options in the college. They have a medical unit that provides basic medicines. Sports facilities are nice at our college. If students are good at sports, they get selected for the main team. Students get an opportunity to play with other colleges.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members at our college are highly qualified. If students are interested in the field of research, they can have this opportunity because they have many connections. The course curriculum is not according to placements. Students have to study separately to get placements. The course curriculum at our college is tough. Students have to study regularly to maintain a 7-pointer. If students don't study, they fail. The attendance should be 75%, which students have to fulfill. If students fail to fulfill, they get debarred from that course.
detailed_review.Other: There are no reservation policies at our college so the crowd here is solely based on merit basis. If students get a good percentile in JEE Main, they can get admission to this college. Campus life here is amazing. We have 3 fests, and they are managed by the student body itself. There are 11 cultural clubs and 7 technical clubs in our college. There is a great bond between seniors and juniors. They encourage students to participate in every event organized by them. The college is located on the outskirts of Jaipur but there are bus services provided by the college which are free. Students can go to the city whenever they want to go. Our college provides scholarships for students who have a pointer above 9. Scholarships are available for BPL students also, but they have to work for college.

admission.title: LNMIIT Admission Overview 2026
admission.overview_text:
LNMIT Jaipur admissions are primarily entrance-based. Students are offered several undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral courses in the field of Science and Technology. The courses are offered in full-time mode. LNM Institute of Information Technology applications are accepted online throught its website. Students are selected based on national-level entrance test scores. Interested students can read the following article to know about the admission criteria and process for LNMIIT .

Download :

LNMIIT Jaipur UG Admission Manual

LNMIIT Jaipur PG Admission Manual

faqs.answer: LNM Institute of Information Technology admissions are expected to open soon. Interested students need to visit the website to get the latest LNMIIT admission updates . The application process is online only.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in LNMIIT?
faqs.answer: To get admission in LNMIIT, you need to meet the programme's eligibility. If eligible, you can apply online at the institute's website. LNMIIT will shortlist students based on entrance scores or on a merit basis. For seat confirmation, pay the admission fees.

faqs.question: How many marks are required in JEE Main to get admission in LNMIIT Jaipur?
faqs.answer: Students must obtain a minimum of 60% in Class 12 with PCM courses for LNMIIT Jaipur B.Tech admission. In JEE Main, obtaining a good percentile is necessary to get through. The marks needed differ according to specialisation and cut-off trends. The shortlisted students are invited for counselling and seat allotment.

faqs.question: Can I get admission at LNMIIT Jaipur without an entrance exam?
faqs.answer: Admission into LNMIIT Jaipur is primarily entrance-based for all UG, PG, and PhD programmes. However, board toppers of Class 12 can receive direct admission in BTech under the direct mode. For other programmes such as MSc and MTech, it is compulsory to clear the concerned entrance exam. Entrance tests provide merit-based selection as well as transparency.

faqs.question: Does LNMIIT Jaipur accept admission through JEE Main?
faqs.answer: Yes, LNMIIT Jaipur admits BTech courses through JEE Main merit. Candidates are also required to meet the 60% eligibility criteria in Class 12 with PCM as subjects. Shortlisted candidates are given consideration for seat allocation during counselling. Selection is determined by merit and the availability of seats.

faqs.question: How can I get a seat for MSc at LNM Institute of Information Technology?
faqs.answer: LNM Institute of Information Technology MSc seats are offered to students via different admission modes. Candidates who have a valid score in the CUET PG or JAM exam are offered seats based on their scores. For those who have not appeared in either of the exams, the institute organises an interview process. In this process, the candidates are evaluated based on their knowledge of the domain, interpersonal skills, etc.

faqs.question: What is the admission process for The LNM Institute of Information Technology Jaipur?
faqs.answer: Admission in LNMIIT Jaipur varies with the programme and entry mode. BTech admission is based on JEE Main (Regular Mode), board topper choice (Direct Mode), or Lateral Entry for Diploma holders. The application is done online, with personal information, academic marks, and entrance examination scores. It is chosen through merit based on JEE Main percentile, Class 12 percentage, or Diploma performance.

faqs.question: Can I apply for BTech at The LNM Institute of Information Technology Jaipur without JEE Main score?
faqs.answer: No, you cannot apply for BTech at The LNM Institute of Information Technology Jaipur without a JEE Main score. LNMIIT's admission process primarily relies on a candidate's JEE Main score. However, if you are among the top 10 rank holders of the Rajasthan Board, LNMIIT may consider your admission directly. Here's the elgibilty criteria for B.Tech at LNM Institute of Information Technology

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for the BTech course at LNMIIT?
faqs.answer: Aspirants who are willing to get admission to the BTech programme at LNMIIT must fulfill the basic eligibility requirements. As per the eligibility criteria, students must have secured a 60% mark or equivalent grade in Class 12 with Mathematics , Physics, and Chemistry as main subjects. Moreover, students must have also secured a minimum of 60% in Class 10 examinations.

faqs.question: Can I get admission at LNMIIT in a BTech course without JEE Main?
faqs.answer: Yes, students who have not appeared for JEE Main can still get admission to the LNMIIT BTech programme. The mode of admission that does not require a JEE Main score is the 'Board Toppers' admission mode. In this mode, students who have secured the top positions in the Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education (or any other recognised board of India) are offered admissions based on their rank. Only the topper of each board who has applied to LNMIIT for admission and fulfills the eligibility criteria gets admission to the chosen course. The rest of the applicants who have applied under the same mode are offered admissions based on availability of the seats.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for LNMIIT BTech admissions via Board Toppers admission mode?

faqs.question: How many BTech seats are available at LNMIIT?
faqs.answer: A total of 640 students can do a BTech from LNMIIT at a time. These seats are distributed among different specialisations offered under the programme. The distribution of seats among various BTech specialisations may vary, depending on the university's specific allocation. Students must note that the aforementioned seat intake is as per official sources. However, it is subject to change.

faqs.question: Can I take admission in LNM Institute of Information Technology M.Tech without GATE?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is possible to get admission to the LNM Institute of Information Technology M.Tech programme without a valid GATE score. Those who have not appeared for GATE or do not meet the institute's GATE cutoff can apply via CUET PG scores. If students have not taken CUET PG, then they can apply via qualifying exam marks or appear for the institute's written test.

faqs.question: How can I get M.Tech seat at LNM Institute of Information Technology?
faqs.answer: MTech seats offered at LNM Institute of Information Technology are offered to students based on marks obtained in the accepted entrance test (GATE/CUET PG) or qualifying exam marks. For each mode of admission, the institute has set predetermined cutoffs. Those who meet the cutoff are offered direct admissions. For those who do not meet the cutoff, the institute organises an institute level written test.

faqs.question: Are GATE-qualified students offered scholarships at LNM Institute of Information Technology?
faqs.answer: Yes, at LNM Institute of Information Technology, students who have a valid GATE score are offered multiple scholarships. Firstly, GATE-qualified students can avail scholarships offered by AICTE. Other than this, students are also eligible for a monthly stipend provided by the university. The university offers INR 28,510 per month to students with a valid GATE score.

faqs.question: What is the admission procedure for CUET PG candidates seeking admission to LNM Institute of Information Technology M.Tech programme?
faqs.answer: Candidates who have a valid CUET PG score are eligible for LNM Institute of Information Technology M.Tech admissions. The institute has prescribed a CUET PG cutoff. Those who meet the cutoff and fulfill the eligibility criteria are offered direct admission to the programme. Such candidates must fill out the application form and pay an application fee of INR 500 (INR 250 for female applicants). After filling out the form, they must watch out for the release of the merit list. It is generally released in the month of December of the current academic year. If selected, students would be required to complete the document verification and fee payment process.

faqs.question: Can I apply offline for LNM Institute of Information Technology (LNMIIT)?
faqs.answer: No, LNM Institute of Information Technology (LNMIIT) applications are accepted in online mode only. This information is as per the official LNMIIT website. All the interested students have to register online for the course of choice.

faqs.question: What is the fee structure for B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering at The LNM Institute of Information Technology?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee structure for Bachelor of Technology in Mechanical Engineering at The LNM Institute of Information Technology is INR 17.26 Lakh. Hostel Fees: INR 4.05 Lakh The fees might include components other than hostel fees. Meal Plan is included in mentioned fee. One-time Payment includes Caution Money (Refundable No interest is payable) is INR 10,000.

faqs.answer: During LNMIIT admissions, students need to submit some documents. The documents have to be submitted online. See the list below to know about the important documents:

faqs.question: Can PhD students at LNMIIT Jaipur apply for external scholarships?
faqs.answer: LNMIIT Jaipur Ph.D. students are permitted to look for scholarships from the UGC, CSIR, NBHM and similar institutions. They could also discover available funding on websites such as the National Scholarship Portal and SERB-CII Fellowship Scheme.

faqs.question: Are part-time PhD candidates at LNMIIT Jaipur eligible for financial support?
faqs.answer: At LNMIIT Jaipur, only full-time Ph.D. students qualify for the institute fellowship. Even so, full-time students can get fellowships and must serve as a TA or RA while their support lasts.

faqs.question: What specialisations are offered under the LNMIIT BTech + M.Tech programme?
faqs.answer: LNM Institute of Information Technology offers a full-time BTech + M.Tech programme. This integrated course is designed for students who wish to pursue a PG integrated course. Under this programme, two specialisations are offered. These specialisations are BTech + M.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) and BTech + M.Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE). Both courses are offered for a duration of five years.

faqs.answer: MTech seats offered at LNM Institute of Information Technology are offered to students based on marks obtained in the accepted entrance test (GATE/CUET PG) or qualifying exam marks. For each mode of admission, the institute has set predetermined cutoffs. Those who meet the cutoff are offered direct admissions. For those who do not meet the cutoff, the institute organises an institute level written test. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Are GATE-qualified students offered scholarships at LNM Institute of Information Technology?
faqs.answer: Yes, at LNM Institute of Information Technology, students who have a valid GATE score are offered multiple scholarships. Firstly, GATE-qualified students can avail scholarships offered by AICTE. Other than this, students are also eligible for a monthly stipend provided by the university. The university offers INR 28,510 per month to students with a valid GATE score. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the admission procedure for CUET PG candidates seeking admission to LNM Institute of Information Technology M.Tech programme?
faqs.answer: Candidates who have a valid CUET PG score are eligible for LNM Institute of Information Technology M.Tech admissions. The institute has prescribed a CUET PG cutoff. Those who meet the cutoff and fulfill the eligibility criteria are offered direct admission to the programme. Such candidates must fill out the application form and pay an application fee of INR 500 (INR 250 for female applicants). After filling out the form, they must watch out for the release of the merit list. It is generally released in the month of December of the current academic year. If selected, students would be required to complete the document verification and fee payment process. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Can I apply offline for LNM Institute of Information Technology (LNMIIT)?
faqs.answer: No, LNM Institute of Information Technology (LNMIIT) applications are accepted in online mode only. This information is as per the official LNMIIT website. All the interested students have to register online for the course of choice. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Are part-time PhD candidates at LNMIIT Jaipur eligible for financial support?

faqs.question: What specialisations are offered under the LNMIIT BTech + M.Tech programme?
faqs.answer: LNM Institute of Information Technology offers a full-time BTech + M.Tech programme. This integrated course is designed for students who wish to pursue a PG integrated course. Under this programme, two specialisations are offered. These specialisations are BTech + M.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) and BTech + M.Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE). Both courses are offered for a duration of five years. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

text: Check out more details in the below videos:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The central library comprises of more than 15000 text and reference books which holds the collection in the area-Science, technology, engineering, humanities, social sciences, management. It has subscribed to 65 periodicals/journals which includes national and international. Few of the periodicals are accessible in both the formats online and print. Other than that reports,thesis,CDs,magazines are also accessible through Institutional repository. Services such as digital library, photocopying has also been facilitated by the library. About 3500 international journals are accessible through subscribed database.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: LNMIIT has well furnished hostels for both boys and girls within the campus which are available on single and double occupancy basis with facilities such as air cooling and wi-fi. TV rooms are also their. For people with disability lift facility is also there. There is one girls hostel and 3 boys hostels with 2 dinning mess halls.

highlights.summary:
Uttaranchal University, is a public university founded in 2005 and situated in Dehradun. The university recognised by the UGC, BCI and PCI. The university is AICTE approved and accredited with an 'A+' grade by NAAC.
It offers various UG and PG level programmes across various streams such as Engineering, Law, Management, Nursing, Paramedical, Science and others. The flagship courses are BTech, BSc and MBA.
The University has experienced and trained faculty members with years of experience. It has good infrastructure which includes labs, library, auditorium, conference hall, sports complex, hostel, etc.

Uttaranchal University Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA)
reviews.review_title: Really good infrastructure, but the fees are a little bit on the higher side, education is good.

detailed_review.Placements: If you work beyond average, you can get a package. The average 4 to 5 LPA you can expect. Many companies visit the college. Mainly, job offers are on the marketing side. The highest package they claim in BBA is 10 LPA, and the average is 4 to 5 LPA. 70 to 80 per cent of students get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is on top-notch, no compromises with this. All facilities are available, like Wi-Fi campus, green campus, each library for each department, canteen food is at a reasonable price, sports available, games available in the hostel, and Wi-Fi speed is a little slow.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are knowledgeable. The course curriculum is also relevant and industry-integrated. All teachers are good-natured, and they are helpful in nature. If you attend the classes regularly, you can easily pass the semester exam, this is not so tough.
detailed_review.Other: Events are fabulous. The weather conditions are good. You see mountains, greenery.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA)
reviews.review_title: Good nature vibes, infrastructure is old but it's okay, cafeteria is crowded.

detailed_review.Placements:
1. It was around 80 students in 1st semester. 
2. The highest package was around 6-7 LPA, the lowest was 2-2.5lpa, avg was around between 3-4 LPA. 
3. Top recruiting company in BBA was Wipro, Accenture, Deloitte, TCS, IBM, HCL, Capgemini, Infosys, ITC, and HDFC Bank
4. Around 30?40% of BBA students get internships in companies
5. Top roles were marketing executive, hr manager, digital marketing specials.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities is good Wi-Fi works sometimes nicely but most times not good, we have computer labs, classrooms are quite good, and library is also good. Hostel Facilities are good as I have home here but I know from friend, mess also good sports are also held.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good helpful and also qualified and they have great knowledge. Yes this course is very good, through practical knowledge and internships you cam gain much knowledge. Semester exams are easy not so hard in this college. Pass percentage is 40 marks per subject.
detailed_review.Other: I choose BBA to build my business knowledge more strong. I love that after doing this course I got knowledge about digital tools and marketing knowledge. I think they should improve Wi-Fi services and AC. Fest is done in every year campus is crowded, connectivity of network inside class is not so good, campus is pretty nice, surroundings are good covered with nature, Scholarship is available, Extracurricular Activities likes sports held every year here.

reviews.course: B.Com. with ACCA Certification Course
reviews.review_title: It is a very good college.

detailed_review.Placements: Many students get placed in my course, so I cannot say the exact number. The highest package offered, as per my knowledge, is 12 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course are HSBC, Amazon, Infosys, Citibank, Deloitte, KPMG, and EY. 60 percent of students get internships from my course. Roles like financial analyst, auditor, and global chartered accountant are offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Network stability is too low. I give it 2 stars. Labs are clean and very peaceful. Classrooms are well-maintained and comfortable. The library has many collections of books, and we can take books from there according to our mindset. I do not stay in the hostel, so I do not know about it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful. They are qualified from the top colleges of India. Their knowledge level is very high. Teaching quality is also good. The course curriculum is relevant. It makes students industry-ready. Not only for India, but it is also open for a global career.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure, supportive faculty, and strong IT learning experience with decent placements

detailed_review.Placements: 80 percent of students were placed. The highest packages are up to 150 LPA (international) and 60 LPA (domestic), with the average package around 5–6 LPA, and the lowest around 2.5–3.5 LPA per holder. Top recruiting companies are Microsoft, Google, Adobe, Amazon, Wipro, Deloitte, TCS, Capgemini, and Infosys. About 30 percent of students reported internships in companies like Google, Zscaler, Hike, IBM, and Amazon.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The university offers good facilities for the B.Sc. IT department, including high-speed Wi-Fi, well-equipped computer labs, smart classrooms, and a resourceful central library. Hostels are clean, secure, and provide Wi-Fi, 24/7 electricity, and common rooms. The mess and canteen food are hygienic and decent, with multiple options. Medical needs are handled through an on-campus health centre with first-aid and ambulance availability. The campus also has indoor and outdoor sports facilities, including grounds, courts, and recreation areas. Overall, the infrastructure is well-maintained and student-friendly.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are generally helpful, well-qualified, and knowledgeable, and the teaching quality is considered good, with practical learning support. The course curriculum is relevant and industry-oriented, including workshops, labs, projects, and certification that help students become job-ready. Semester exams are of moderate difficulty, manageable with regular study. The pass percentage usually ranges between 85%–95%, depending on the course and department.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the B.Sc. IT course because I wanted strong technical skills and good career opportunities in IT. The best things about the course are its practical labs, supportive faculty, updated curriculum, and good placement exposure. I wish there were more advanced coding workshops and industry tie-ups for added hands-on experience. The university hosts regular events, fests, and tech activities, and the campus crowd is friendly and diverse. The campus is well-connected, with a clean and green environment. Scholarships and extracurricular activities are also available, making the overall student experience positive.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA)
reviews.review_title: This college is good. I like this college.

detailed_review.Placements: I don't know that much but 50 to 60% of students get placements. 40 LPA to 50 LPA is the highest package in my course, and 6 LPA to 7 LPA is the lowest package in my course. I don't know exactly but I think 30 to 40% of students get internships. Recruiting companies are IBM, Amazon, Google, and so many other companies. Roles offered are HR and CEO entrepreneur.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi and library are available. Classrooms are also good, they are clean. But there is network issue. The phone's network didn't come, so we can't use the net properly. Wi-Fi network also doesn't work properly. Library is good, and so many books available in the library. Food is not that' much good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good and qualified. They give us knowledge of books and outside of the books also. They are friendly in nature. It makes students industry-ready. Exams are average not that much tough. If you read properly and listen to the teachers properly, then the exams are easy.
detailed_review.Other: I have an interest in business that's why I chose BBA. Nothing needs improvement. It is very nice and I like fests and events of my college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in CSE (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: UIT, B.Tech course in specialization of AI and ML.

detailed_review.Placements: The total percentage of students placed from the college last year, 2024 was around 75%. The average package offered in B.Tech computer science course is around 5 LPA. Many recruiting companies come, specially for the students who have specialisation in AI and ML as this is a demanding branch that's why the starting package of these courses are way too high. Try to get up in more competitions, such as hackathons or any other coding challenges through which there are high chances to get placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has given all the required facilities to the student, so that they don't have to go out of campus for getting something. The marketplace is also provided in college area. The medical facilities are also up to the mark in case of any emergency happens to students.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are very good in our college. They are highly qualified and easily approachable in case of any doubt. Also the faculty create doubt session beyond the class hours which are really helpful. The semester exam are not that difficult also important question are told by faculty members itself.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: B.Tech course at Uttarachal University.

detailed_review.Placements: The college has many positive reviews regarding placements. The college provides a good balance between academics and extracurricular activities. It also focuses on group discussions. Many other sessions that helps during placements. Regular workshops are also conducted by guest faculty members.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is properly made with well-maintained classrooms having proper ventilation. The classroom size is around 80 students. Hostel facilities are decent, with rooms having furniture. There is proper security with an allotted warden for each hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most professors in our college are very knowledgeable. They are easily approachable. You need not hesitate to ask them about any issues. They guide you during your academics. They also provide advice on your career choices after you complete your PG courses.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: Uit BCA course Dehradun.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement record of the college is very good, and you can also apply for various kinds of scholarships and internships, through which you can also receive a stipend. If you score more than 6.5 CGPA, you are eligible to sit in the placements and interview grounds. Interviews are conducted in three grounds. The first round is aptitude test, after which you are selected for the second round, which is a group discussion, and in the third round, there is a one to one interview with the company itself.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are always many complaints regarding the hostel facilities, which are also not being properly taken care of by the college itself. Food is very degraded and not prepared hygienically. Most of the students prefer to take flats outside the college premises to avoid such conditions.
detailed_review.Faculty: These are the very best and highly knowledgeable, their respective courses and subjects. For each subject, there is a specialized faculty or Ph.D. professors which teaches you through the best teaching methods. You can also ask for help from them regarding any type of queries.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: BCA course in UIT- USCS Dehradun.

detailed_review.Placements: The college placement record is one of the things that has to be appreciated, as the faculty members help a lot in your placement and interviews, train you regarding that, which also helps in building your resume by making you join hackathons and other such competitions, which keeps the resume looking skilled.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classroom is maintained properly, along with which proper cleaning takes place every day. The class size for one batch of BCA is around 76 students. Wi-Fi facilities are not good on campus, and in the hostel, asking for Wi-Fi facilities is way too costly.
detailed_review.Faculty: Curriculum or the academic syllabus is prepared and updated every year by keeping the future scope in the branch, and also the required subjects important for placement purposes. The faculty members also focus on your core subjects and ask you to complete the remaining by yourself.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good hostel & events, average academics, and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement rate for B.Tech CSE at Uttaranchal University is not very high. Students are able to secure good placements only if they consistently focus on their studies and skill development throughout the four years of the course. Some of the well known companies that visit the campus for placements include TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Cognizant, Accenture, HCL Technologies, IBM India, Tech Mahindra, Capgemini, and Deloitte, which provide opportunities mainly for IT services and software roles. Students should note that getting placed in these companies largely depends on their performance, preparation, and the skills they develop during the four years of study.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is value for money, and the food in the mess is quite good. Breakfast, lunch, and snacks are well prepared, though dinner could be better. Canteen food is average. Wi-Fi is available 24/7, but in some areas, the connectivity is not very stable. Medical facilities are provided, and in the evening, students enjoy playing cricket and football on the ground. The only drawback of the hostel is that the warden tends to be too strict. All the academic buildings are equipped with well maintained laboratories, which are helpful for practical learning. Classrooms are decent but quite basic.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are very good and highly knowledgeable, while a few others, though knowledgeable, tend to show unnecessary attitude. Course curriculum is average and could be improved. Exams are not too difficult, as some teachers provide a lot of support, including question banks, which makes preparation easier for students.
detailed_review.Other: Events at the university are enjoyable, especially the annual Youva Fest, which is a three day cultural festival filled with fun and activities. Students participate with great enthusiasm, and its one of the most memorable experiences on campus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in CSE (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: UIT College, Dehradun for the course B.Teach.

detailed_review.Placements: I have enrolled in the course B.Teach in Computer Science and Engineering with a specialization in AI and ML. The reason for choosing this course is its high demand and high placement records. Many companies specially reach colleges for engineers with a specialization in AI and ML. The starting package for this course in this college is around 7LPA. You can also get internships very easily if you score good grades in your first year. In the college, it is compulsory to complete at least two major internships and one minor internship.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I like the college campus very much as it is so huge, surrounded by so much land with all the facilities. There are many cafeterias or food courts in the college itself. There are many sports and game facilities in the college for the students who are very fond of sports. Other than this, the college also conducts many seminars or functions at least once in two weeks to gain engagement among students.
detailed_review.Faculty: I feel like the faculty members are very helpful from the starting years itself and want students to experience every aspect of learning through real-world scenarios. The faculty members help a lot regarding minor projects, whose topics are suggested by the faculty itself so that we can present them in front of the companies. Other than this, the faculty members also want to publish their own research papers to upgrade their resume.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in CSE (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: University for B.Tech AI/Ml.

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently a fresher at this college. But by talking to our seniors and being told by our faculty members, the placement record for this college is highly appreciable. The college claims 90% rate for placement which is a major big factor in approaching this college, being a private college. Among most of the colleges in Dehradun, Uttaranchal is considered among the best because of the affordable fee structure and the placement records.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of the college is highly admirable and well-maintained with proper cleanliness and all the facilities required by the students. Most of the facilities are provided by the college in the tuition and hostel fees themselves. There are no additional charges for them. Other than this, there are sports facilities through which you can play lots of games in inter-college competitions.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very knowledgeable and highly qualified from good universities. They have great teaching experience over many years. Apart from this, the college faculty members take care of the course curriculum and maintain a proper decorum in class. In addition to this, there are strict rules and regulations regarding your attendance and seating in examinations.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and all the necessary facilities are available in this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Regarding the placements and internships, the college is very focused and tries to get a larger number of placements for the students. There is a specific specialized placement team in our college that handles all the interviews and internship work. The highest package from this college is around 1 crore per annum in the B.Tech field, while in the BCA field, it is 40 LPA. The lowest packages for every field range from 3 LPA to 5 LPA. Recruiting companies mainly focus on roles like software engineer, graphic designer, animation specialists, and many other roles for which you can apply.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I am very much like the infrastructure of this college. Additionally, the college provides all necessary facilities, including free Wi-Fi. Furthermore, the classrooms are spacious. Our college has three to four sports grounds, as well as a library area where you can borrow books for your course.
detailed_review.Faculty: The semester exams are not hard to pass. The passing percentage of these examinations is approximately 70%. Other than this, the difficulties mainly focus on your academics and help you in securing good marks and CGPA by providing you with previous year question papers and other study material, which are very helpful during the exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: For B.Tech, it is the best preference.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement report of the college is very positive, but from your side, you also have to do a lot of hard work and practice many more interviews and group discussions together, and there is a good package in this college. The average package from this college is around six Lacs per annum.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure and the department buildings are very good and spacious. The college also has many built-in facilities, such as a library for each course, Wi-Fi, which is available all the time. In addition to this, the college also has its own temple. The seniors of the college are also very helpful and nice.
detailed_review.Faculty: The courses offered in the college are B.Tech in various specialisation fields, then BCA, M.Tech, MBA, and LAW. The examinations are also held on time at a gap of every four months, and each month college conducts many classroom tests, which are added to internal marking.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: UIT College in Dehradun is the best among private colleges.

detailed_review.Placements: At Uttarakhand University, you can expect a good placement if you really work hard for it and maintain a good score card every semester. Other than this, you can apply for an internship in various companies according to your field of interest.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel facilities are pretty average. There are various restrictions regarding outing time, you are not allowed to go out of hostel after 7 pm, which can be considered a disadvantage. More than college has strict rules regarding maintaining a proper dress code.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching faculty members are very nice in this college, and they also take care of your attendance if it falls below 75%. Maintaining a good relationship with faculty members and maintaining discipline in their classes gives you good marks in internal practical.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: BCA course in UIT Dehradun.

detailed_review.Placements: Regarding the placement, for each course, placement depends, as the highest package goes for B.Tech course and the lowest package goes for law student. Talking about BCA course, the placement level is moderate. There are companies that come for recruitment, and the college placement team helps a lot in training students for these interviews.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is too good, it is what you expect from a private college, and the college is considered good among most of the private colleges of Dehradun. The college also provides bus facilities for day scholar students. In addition to this, the college also has an E-vehicle on the campus to avoid walking from one department to another.
detailed_review.Faculty: Exam for each semester is not very hard or high-level, so you can easily score good grades.
detailed_review.Other: Major improvement required by the college is for their faculty members they take less interest in the completion of academic work, which in turn gives the burden to the students themselves to complete it.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Brief review about my college.

detailed_review.Placements: Currently, I am pursuing my Bachelor's in Computer Science and Engineering with a specialization in Information and Technology from this college. The placement record for my particular branch is great, and the highest package goes up to 1.2 CPA. Overall, you will have a great experience in this college as the college takes care of your placements and also provides you with internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college is excellent in terms of infrastructure, including the classrooms, libraries, and other resources that enhance the learning experience and student experience of getting into a great college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty-to-student ratio is absolutely fine, and the relationship between faculty members is always very nice and supportive. Whether it's a personal or college-level problem, faculty members are always there to help you, even beyond college hours. Semester exams are held within every five months. Also, these exams are not very tough, and the college provides you with study materials on your student ERP (portals through which you can check your attendance and other things).

reviews.course: Bachelor of Arts (B.A.)
reviews.review_title: This college is very good for students because it also provides an EMI option.

detailed_review.Placements: In this college, for B.A. course 33% is required to take admission. Placement is offered from the college side. Minimum package is Rs. 3,00,000 to Rs. 7,00,000. Recruiting companies are like Wipro, Tech Mahindra, HCL, and more. 50% of students got internships, and the role offers are Customer Care Executive, Receptionist, Team Leader, and more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are like a good environment, activities, library, computer classes, trips, free Wi-Fi, and more. Hostel facilities are very good, like food quality, cleanliness is good, and more. In hostel, rooms are very hygienic and beautiful, and the outdoor view is awesome.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers are very nice, they always support and guide the accurate things, and the course curriculum is very relevant and is ready for students' industry. Semester exams are normal in this college, and passing percentage is 33% required to qualify for the exam.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this B.A. course because it helps me pursue B.Ed. All the facilities are very impressive. College celebrates the fresher party, which is very good for students.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: College is good for BCA course.

detailed_review.Placements: College offers you variety of placements in many private companies such as Infosys, TWS, or HCL with an average package between 3 LPA to 4 LPA. To get a great placement, it is recommended to add the skills in your resume by joining workshops, attending hackathons, and various other types of skill-building sessions to get a higher package.

You can also visit the nearby places during the outing time given by the college. The food facility is pretty average, but it is prepared hygienically. Also, the college consists of Nescafe and many other food courts.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are really helpful during exams or practicals. They try to give you as many important questions as possible for the exams to get better scores. A personal view is that it is mandatory to get a good image in front of the faculty members. They are also responsible for your placements and recommending you as a great person who is a good fit for the role.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: Good college with respect to infrastructure and fee structure.

detailed_review.Placements: Currently, I am pursuing my Bachelor's in Computer Applications from Uttaranchal University. In this college, the placement record is nice compared to other private colleges. All you need to know is that placement is in your hands. You need to score well in your academics. Also, maintain discipline and a proper image in the eyes of faculty members, as sometimes not keeping the proper discipline can lead to a reduction of marks from your exams.
